basics.name: Patrik Marin
basics.label: Student • Programmer
basics.summary: Hello there! I'm Patrik Marin, ${age}-year-old student from Espoo, Finland studying Information Networks and interested in information visualization, information security and networks. On this site I've highlighted some of the projects I've created during the past few years and also some of the photographs I've taken.

work.summary: Currently I'm working as a full-stack web developer with Node / React / AWS and have also done UX/UI design with Adobe XD.
During the summer I was part of team creating a Node.JS application with TypeScript and D3.JS visualisation library. I also learned how to use the Contentful CDN.

I was part of internal development and mostly programmed in Java, but also used lot of SQL commands and procedures. Shell scripts were an everyday tool and I also became familiar with DevOps components.
I was a seasonal worker at Hullut Päivät, Stockmann Oyj in the grocery side. My tasks were mostly cutting and packaging different types of cheese, but I also refilled the store’s shelves.
This was a student-run company in high school as a part of Nuori Yrittäjyys -program. My main focus was on the marketing, graphic design and website management.

awards.title: Productivity track winner and finalist
awards.summary: We created a web application to match job applicants skills to relevant work places through big data and machine learning.
Our team created a small responsive web application to optimize cleaning routes using intelligent building data.
We participated in a service design competition about machine learning, AI and IoT.

awards.title: Finalist
awards.summary: Our team had to come up with a digital innovation for the Finnish Defence Forces. We made it all the way to the finals at Slush, where we had 3 minutes to pitch the idea we had perfected during the intensive 2 month sprint.
